titleStmt.title: W. Garnet et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10375

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency Beria Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

your Petitioners would say to your Excellency that William Lampkin was fined at the last term of the Powell Circuit Court one hundred Dollars under an indictment, and is now, lying in Jail under said Judgment

Mr Lumpkins is a very poor man and cannot pay said Judgment and has no relative that is able to bail him or replevy the in order that he might thereby get out of Jail and will have ^to^ Continue in Jail till said fine is paid, unless said fine is remitted.
we therefore pray your Excellency, to remit said fine. believing that it is the wish of all acquainted with the Circustances

W garnet
J S. Marten
M. I Pagg
Davd P Rose
John L Martin
Ch. J Duncan
Wm Mize
Green v Hall
John A Rose
George King
Aron Frazer
Wm Haskins
William Evens

Powell Cir. Ct
Respite 12 mo
B. M
$100 }
Wm Lumpkins
Issd MApr 11 1861
